page.title: 19Places of Worship. (Part 2)
page.content: Since 1834, the priests have always been{Benedictine}fathers. In recent years, the inside of the church has started to crumble, so it has been{ {restored}and now looks more modern. The{Ecumenical Centre}is next to the Job Centre in the Kingfisher Shopping Centre. It is 10 years old and is used not only as a church but also for play groups and Brownies. It also has a cafe. The{Redditch Mosque}in Easemore Road used to be a house. It is a building for Muslims to pray in. Some of the children from St. Stephen's First School go to the Mosque to pray and to learn the Koran. There is also a{Baptist}church and a{Salvation Army building in our 12km block. In 1985 a new{Methodist}church, St. Andrew's, was built in Church Hill. A much older Methodist church remains in Alcester Street.
